00045 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 /** @defgroup SPI_Private_Define SPI private definitions
00047   * @{
00048   */
00049 /* SPI SPIEN Mask                                                                                           */
00050 #define CR0_SPIEN_SET       (u32)0x00000001
00051 #define CR0_SPIEN_RESET     (u32)0xFFFFFFFE
00052 
00053 /* SPI SELOEN Mask                                                                                          */
00054 #define CR0_SELOEN_SET      (u32)0x00000008
00055 #define CR0_SELOEN_RESET    (u32)0xFFFFFFF7
00056 
00057 /* SPI SPI DUALEN Mask                                                                                      */
00058 #define CR0_DUALEN_SET      (u32)0x00000040
00059 #define CR0_DUALEN_RESET    (u32)0xFFFFFFBF
00060 
00061 #if (LIBCFG_QSPI)
00062 /* QSPI QUADEN Mask                                                                                         */
00063 #define CR0_QUADEN_SET      (u32)0x00020000
00064 #define CR0_QUADEN_RESET    (u32)0xFFFDFFFF
00065 /* QSPI QDIODIR Mask                                                                                        */
00066 #define CR0_QDIODIR_OUT     (u32)0x00010000
00067 #define CR0_QDIODIR_IN      (u32)0xFFFEFFFF
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 /* SPI SPI GUADTEN Mask                                                                                     */
00071 #define CR0_GUADTEN_SET     (u32)0x00000080
00072 #define CR0_GUADTEN_RESET   (u32)0xFFFFFF7F
00073 
00074 /* SPI FIFOEN Mask                                                                                          */
00075 #define FCR_FIFOEN_SET      (u32)0x00000400
00076 #define FCR_FIFOEN_RESET    (u32)0xFFFFFBFF
00077 
00078 /* SPI DFL Mask                                                                                             */
00079 #if (LIBCFG_SPI_DATA_LENGTH_V01)
00080 #define CR1_DFL_MASK        (u32)0x00000007
00081 #else
00082 #define CR1_DFL_MASK        (u32)0x0000000F
00083 #endif
00084 
00085 /* SPI FIFO Mask                                                                                            */
00086 #if (LIBCFG_SPI_FIFO_DEPTH_V01)
00087 #define FCR_FIFO_MASK        (u32)0x00000007
00088 #else
00089 #define FCR_FIFO_MASK        (u32)0x0000000F
00090 #endif
00091 
00092 /**
00093   * @}
00094   */

00098 /** @defgroup SPI_Exported_Functions SPI exported functions
00099   * @{
00100   */
00101 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00102  * @brief Deinitialize the SPI peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00103  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00104  * @retval None
00105  ************************************************************************************************************/
00106 void SPI_DeInit(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx)
00107 {
00108   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00109 
00110   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00111   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00112 
00113   if (SPIx == HT_SPI0)
00114   {
00115     RSTCUReset.Bit.SPI0 = 1;
00116   }
00117   #if (LIBCFG_SPI1)
00118   else if (SPIx == HT_SPI1)
00119   {
00120     RSTCUReset.Bit.SPI1 = 1;
00121   }
00122   #endif
00123   #if (LIBCFG_QSPI)
00124   else if (SPIx == HT_QSPI)
00125   {
00126     RSTCUReset.Bit.QSPI = 1;
00127   }
00128   #endif
00129   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00130 }
00131 
00132 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00133  * @brief Initialize the SPIx peripheral according to the specified parameters in the SPI_InitStruct.
00134  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00135  * @param SPI_InitStruct: pointer to a SPI_InitTypeDef structure.
00136  * @retval None
00137  ************************************************************************************************************/
00138 void SPI_Init(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, SPI_InitTypeDef* SPI_InitStruct)
00139 {
00140   u32 tmp;
00141 
00142   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00143   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00144   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_MODE(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_Mode));
00145   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FIFO_SET(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_FIFO));
00146   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_DATALENGTH(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_DataLength));
00147   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_SEL_MODE(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_SELMode));
00148   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_SEL_POLARITY(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_SELPolarity));
00149   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_CPOL(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_CPOL));
00150   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_CPHA(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_CPHA));
00151   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FIRST_BIT(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_FirstBit));
00152   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FIFO_LEVEL(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_RxFIFOTriggerLevel));
00153   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FIFO_LEVEL(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_TxFIFOTriggerLevel));
00154   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_CLOCK_PRESCALER(SPI_InitStruct->SPI_ClockPrescaler));
00155 
00156   /*---------------------------- SPIx Control Register 2 Configuration -------------------------------------*/
00157   tmp =  SPI_InitStruct->SPI_CPOL;
00158   if (tmp == SPI_CPOL_LOW)
00159   {
00160     tmp |= (0x100 << SPI_InitStruct->SPI_CPHA);
00161   }
00162   else
00163   {
00164     tmp |= (0x200 >> SPI_InitStruct->SPI_CPHA);
00165   }
00166 
00167   SPIx->CR1 = SPI_InitStruct->SPI_Mode |  SPI_InitStruct->SPI_DataLength |
00168               SPI_InitStruct->SPI_SELMode | SPI_InitStruct->SPI_SELPolarity |
00169               SPI_InitStruct->SPI_FirstBit | tmp;
00170 
00171   /*---------------------------- SPIx FIFO Control Register Configuration ----------------------------------*/
00172   SPIx->FCR = SPI_InitStruct->SPI_FIFO | SPI_InitStruct->SPI_TxFIFOTriggerLevel |
00173              (SPI_InitStruct->SPI_RxFIFOTriggerLevel << 4);
00174 
00175   /*---------------------------- SPIx Clock Prescaler Register Configuration -------------------------------*/
00176   #if (LIBCFG_SPI_CLK_PRE_V01)
00177   SPIx->CPR = (SPI_InitStruct->SPI_ClockPrescaler - 1);
00178   #else
00179   SPIx->CPR = (SPI_InitStruct->SPI_ClockPrescaler / 2) - 1;
00180   #endif
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00184  * @brief Fill each SPI_InitStruct member with its default value.
00185  * @param SPI_InitStruct: pointer to an SPI_InitTypeDef structure.
00186  * @retval None
00187  ************************************************************************************************************/
00188 void SPI_StructInit(SPI_InitTypeDef* SPI_InitStruct)
00189 {
00190   /* Initialize the SPI_Mode member                                                                         */
00191   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_Mode = SPI_SLAVE;
00192 
00193   /* Initialize the SPI_FIFO member                                                                         */
00194   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_FIFO = SPI_FIFO_DISABLE;
00195 
00196   /* Initialize the SPI_DataLength member                                                                   */
00197   #if (LIBCFG_SPI_DATA_LENGTH_V01)
00198   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_DataLength = SPI_DATALENGTH_8;
00199   #else
00200   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_DataLength = SPI_DATALENGTH_16;
00201   #endif
00202 
00203   /* Initialize the SPI_SELMode member                                                                      */
00204   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_SELMode = SPI_SEL_SOFTWARE;
00205 
00206   /* Initialize the SPI_SELPolarity member                                                                  */
00207   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_SELPolarity = SPI_SELPOLARITY_LOW;
00208 
00209   /* Initialize the SPI_CPOL member                                                                         */
00210   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_CPOL = SPI_CPOL_LOW;
00211 
00212   /* Initialize the SPI_CPHA member                                                                         */
00213   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_CPHA = SPI_CPHA_FIRST;
00214 
00215   /* Initialize the SPI_FirstBit member                                                                     */
00216   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_FirstBit = SPI_FIRSTBIT_MSB;
00217 
00218   /* Initialize the SPI_RxFIFOTriggerLevel member                                                           */
00219   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_RxFIFOTriggerLevel = 0;
00220 
00221   /* Initialize the SPI_TxFIFOTriggerLevel member                                                           */
00222   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_TxFIFOTriggerLevel = 0;
00223 
00224   /* Initialize the SPI_ClockPrescaler member                                                               */
00225   SPI_InitStruct->SPI_ClockPrescaler = 2;
00226 }
00227 
00228 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00229  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified SPI peripheral.
00230  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00231  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00232  * @retval None
00233  ************************************************************************************************************/
00234 void SPI_Cmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, ControlStatus NewState)
00235 {
00236   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00237   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00238   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00239 
00240   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00241   {
00242     /* Enable the selected SPI peripheral                                                                   */
00243     SPIx->CR0 |= CR0_SPIEN_SET;
00244   }
00245   else
00246   {
00247     /* Disable the selected SPI peripheral                                                                  */
00248     SPIx->CR0 &= CR0_SPIEN_RESET;
00249   }
00250 }
00251 
00252 #if (!LIBCFG_SPI_NO_MULTI_MASTER)
00253 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00254  * @brief Enable or Disable the SEL output for the specified SPI peripheral.
00255  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00256  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00257  * @retval None
00258  ************************************************************************************************************/
00259 void SPI_SELOutputCmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, ControlStatus NewState)
00260 {
00261   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00262   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00263   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00264 
00265   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00266   {
00267     SPIx->CR0 |= CR0_SELOEN_SET;
00268   }
00269   else
00270   {
00271     SPIx->CR0 &= CR0_SELOEN_RESET;
00272   }
00273 }
00274 #endif

00276 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00277  * @brief Enable or Disable SPI FIFO.
00278  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00279  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00280  * @retval None
00281  ************************************************************************************************************/
00282 void SPI_FIFOCmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, ControlStatus NewState)
00283 {
00284   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00285   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00286   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00287 
00288   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00289   {
00290     SPIx->FCR |= FCR_FIFOEN_SET;
00291   }
00292   else
00293   {
00294     SPIx->FCR &= FCR_FIFOEN_RESET;
00295   }
00296 }
00297 
00298 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00299  * @brief Configure the data length for the selected SPI.
00300  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00301  * @param SPI_DataLength: specify data length of the SPI.
00302  * @retval None
00303  ************************************************************************************************************/
00304 void SPI_SetDataLength(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u16 SPI_DataLength)
00305 {
00306   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00307   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00308   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_DATALENGTH(SPI_DataLength));
00309 
00310   /* Clear DFL[x:0] in CR1.
00311      if Datalength is 16-bit mode, then x = 3
00312      if Datalength is 8-bit mode, then x = 2                                                                */
00313   SPIx->CR1 &= (u32)~CR1_DFL_MASK;
00314 
00315   /* Set new DFL[x:0] in CR1.
00316      if Datalength is 16-bit mode, then x = 3
00317      if Datalength is 8-bit mode, then x = 2                                                                */
00318   SPIx->CR1 |= SPI_DataLength;
00319 }
00320 
00321 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00322  * @brief SEL pin is configured to be driven by hardware or software.
00323  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00324  * @param SPI_SEL: specify the SPI SEL pin mode.
00325  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00326  *     @arg SPI_SEL_HARDWARE : SEL is driven by hardware
00327  *     @arg SPI_SEL_SOFTWARE : SEL is driven by software
00328  * @retval None
00329  ************************************************************************************************************/
00330 void SPI_SELModeConfig(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 SPI_SEL)
00331 {
00332   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00333   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00334   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_SEL_MODE(SPI_SEL));
00335 
00336   if (SPI_SEL != SPI_SEL_SOFTWARE)
00337   {
00338     SPIx->CR1 |= SPI_SEL_HARDWARE;
00339   }
00340   else
00341   {
00342     SPIx->CR1 &= ~SPI_SEL_HARDWARE;
00343   }
00344 }
00345 
00346 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00347  * @brief Configure the SEL state by software.
00348  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00349  * @param SPI_SoftwareSEL: specify if the SPI SEL to be active or inactive.
00350  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00351  *     @arg SPI_SEL_ACTIVE   : activate SEL signal
00352  *     @arg SPI_SEL_INACTIVE : deactivate SEL signal
00353  * @retval None
00354  ************************************************************************************************************/
00355 void SPI_SoftwareSELCmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 SPI_SoftwareSEL)
00356 {
00357   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00358   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00359   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_SOFTWARE_SEL(SPI_SoftwareSEL));
00360 
00361   if (SPI_SoftwareSEL != SPI_SEL_INACTIVE)
00362   {
00363     SPIx->CR0 |= SPI_SEL_ACTIVE;
00364   }
00365   else
00366   {
00367     SPIx->CR0 &= SPI_SEL_INACTIVE;
00368   }
00369 }
00370 
00371 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00372  * @brief Send a data through the SPIx peripheral.
00373  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00374  * @param SPI_Data: the data to be transmitted.
00375  * @retval None
00376  ************************************************************************************************************/
00377 void SPI_SendData(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, SPI_DataTypeDef SPI_Data)
00378 {
00379   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00380   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00381   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_DATA(SPI_Data));
00382 
00383   SPIx->DR = SPI_Data;
00384 }

00386 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00387  * @brief Return the received data through the SPIx peripheral
00388  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00389  * @retval The value of the received data.
00390  ************************************************************************************************************/
00391 SPI_DataTypeDef SPI_ReceiveData(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx)
00392 {
00393   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00394   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00395 
00396   return (SPI_DataTypeDef)SPIx->DR;
00397 }

00408   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00409 
00410   SPIx->FTOCR = SPI_Timeout;
00411 }

00413 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00414  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified SPI interrupt.
00415  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00416  * @param SPI_Int: specify if the SPI interrupt source to be enabled or disabled.
00417  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00418  *     @arg SPI_INT_TXBE  : SPI Tx buffer empty interrupt
00419  *     @arg SPI_INT_TXE   : SPI Tx empty interrupt
00420  *     @arg SPI_INT_RXBNE : SPI Rx buffer not empty interrupt
00421  *     @arg SPI_INT_WC    : SPI write collision interrupt
00422  *     @arg SPI_INT_RO    : SPI read overrun interrupt
00423  *     @arg SPI_INT_MF    : SPI mode fault interrupt
00424  *     @arg SPI_INT_SA    : SPI slave abort interrupt
00425  *     @arg SPI_INT_TO    : SPI time out interrupt
00426  *     @arg SPI_INT_ALL   : All SPI interrupt
00427  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00428  * @retval None
00429  ************************************************************************************************************/
00430 void SPI_IntConfig(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 SPI_Int, ControlStatus NewState)
00431 {
00432   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00433   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00434   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_INT(SPI_Int));
00435   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00436 
00437   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00438   {
00439     SPIx->IER |= SPI_Int;
00440   }
00441   else
00442   {
00443     SPIx->IER &= (u32)~SPI_Int;
00444   }
00445 }
00446 
00447 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00448  * @brief Check whether the specified SPI flag has been set or not.
00449  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00450  * @param SPI_Flag: specify the flag that is to be check.
00451  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00452  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_TXBE  : SPI Tx buffer empty flag
00453  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_TXE   : SPI Tx empty flag
00454  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_RXBNE : SPI Rx buffer not empty flag
00455  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_WC    : SPI write collision flag
00456  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_RO    : SPI read overrun flag
00457  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_MF    : SPI mode fault flag
00458  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_SA    : SPI slave abort flag
00459  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_TOUT  : SPI time out flag
00460  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_BUSY  : SPI busy flag
00461  * @retval SET or RESET
00462  ************************************************************************************************************/
00463 FlagStatus SPI_GetFlagStatus(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 SPI_Flag)
00464 {
00465   FlagStatus bitstatus = RESET;
00466   u32 statusreg = 0;
00467 
00468   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00469   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00470   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FLAG(SPI_Flag));
00471 
00472   statusreg = SPIx->SR;
00473 
00474   if ((statusreg & SPI_Flag) != (u32)RESET)
00475   {
00476     bitstatus = SET;
00477   }
00478   else
00479   {
00480     bitstatus = RESET;
00481   }
00482 
00483   return bitstatus;
00484 }
00485 
00486 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00487  * @brief Return the status of specified SPI FIFO.
00488  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00489  * @param SPI_FIFODirection: specify the FIFO that is to be checked.
00490  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00491  *     @arg SPI_FIFO_TX :
00492  *     @arg SPI_FIFO_RX :
00493  * @retval The number of data in Tx FIFO or Rx FIFO.
00494  ************************************************************************************************************/
00495 u8 SPI_GetFIFOStatus(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 SPI_FIFODirection)
00496 {
00497   u32 tmpreg;
00498 
00499   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00500   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00501   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FIFO_DIRECTION(SPI_FIFODirection));
00502 
00503   if (SPI_FIFODirection == SPI_FIFO_TX)
00504   {
00505     tmpreg = SPIx->FSR & FCR_FIFO_MASK;
00506   }
00507   else
00508   {
00509     tmpreg = (SPIx->FSR & (FCR_FIFO_MASK << 4)) >> 4;
00510   }
00511 
00512   return (u8)tmpreg;
00513 }
00514 
00515 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00516  * @brief Clear the specified SPI flag.
00517  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00518  * @param SPI_Flag: specify the flag that is to be cleared.
00519  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00520  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_WC   : SPI write collision flag
00521  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_RO   : SPI read overrun flag
00522  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_MF   : SPI mode fault flag
00523  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_SA   : SPI slave abort flag
00524  *     @arg SPI_FLAG_TOUT : SPI time out flag
00525  * @retval None
00526  ************************************************************************************************************/
00527 void SPI_ClearFlag(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 SPI_Flag)
00528 {
00529   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00530   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00531   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FLAG_CLEAR(SPI_Flag));
00532 
00533   SPIx->SR = SPI_Flag;
00534 }
00535 
00536 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00537  * @brief Set the trigger level of SPI FIFO.
00538  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00539  * @param SPI_FIFODirection: specify the FIFO that is to be set.
00540  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00541  *     @arg SPI_FIFO_TX :
00542  *     @arg SPI_FIFO_RX :
00543  * @param SPI_FIFOLevel: Specify the FIFO trigger level.
00544  * @retval None
00545  ************************************************************************************************************/
00546 void SPI_FIFOTriggerLevelConfig(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 SPI_FIFODirection, u8 SPI_FIFOLevel)
00547 {
00548   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00549   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00550   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FIFO_DIRECTION(SPI_FIFODirection));
00551   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_FIFO_LEVEL(SPI_FIFOLevel));
00552 
00553   if (SPI_FIFODirection == SPI_FIFO_TX)
00554   {
00555     SPIx->FCR = ((SPIx->FCR & (0x00000400 | (FCR_FIFO_MASK << 4))) | SPI_FIFOLevel);
00556   }
00557   else
00558   {
00559     SPIx->FCR = ((SPIx->FCR & (0x00000400 | FCR_FIFO_MASK)) | (SPI_FIFOLevel << 4));
00560   }
00561 }
00562 
00563 #if (LIBCFG_PDMA)
00564 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00565  * @brief Enable or Disable the SPIx PDMA interface.
00566  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00567  * @param SPI_PDMAREQ: specify the SPI PDMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled.
00568  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00569  *     @arg SPI_PDMAREQ_TX : Tx PDMA transfer request
00570  *     @arg SPI_PDMAREQ_RX : Rx PDMA transfer request
00571  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00572  * @retval None
00573  ************************************************************************************************************/
00574 void SPI_PDMACmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 SPI_PDMAREQ, ControlStatus NewState)
00575 {
00576   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00577   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00578   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_PDMA_REQ(SPI_PDMAREQ));
00579   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00580 
00581   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00582   {
00583     SPIx->CR0 |= SPI_PDMAREQ;
00584   }
00585   else
00586   {
00587     SPIx->CR0 &= ~SPI_PDMAREQ;
00588   }
00589 }
00590 #endif
00591 
00592 #if (!LIBCFG_SPI_NO_DUAL)
00593 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00594  * @brief Enable or Disable the SPIx dual port read interface.
00595  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00596  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00597  * @retval None
00598  ************************************************************************************************************/
00599 void SPI_DUALCmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, ControlStatus NewState)
00600 {
00601   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00602   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00603   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00604 
00605   (NewState == ENABLE)?(SPIx->CR0 |= CR0_DUALEN_SET):(SPIx->CR0 &= CR0_DUALEN_RESET);
00606 }
00607 #endif
00608 
00609 #if (LIBCFG_QSPI)
00610 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00611  * @brief Enable or Disable the QSPI quad port interface.
00612  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected QSPI from the QSPI peripherals.
00613  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00614  * @retval None
00615  ************************************************************************************************************/
00616 void QSPI_QuadCmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, ControlStatus NewState)
00617 {
00618   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00619   Assert_Param(IS_QSPI(SPIx));
00620   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00621 
00622   if (NewState == DISABLE)
00623   {
00624     QSPI_DirectionConfig(SPIx, SIO_DIR_IN);
00625     SPIx->CR0 &= CR0_QUADEN_RESET;
00626   }
00627   else
00628   {
00629     SPIx->CR0 |= CR0_QUADEN_SET;
00630   }
00631 }
00632 
00633 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00634  * @brief Configure the direction of SIO pins in dual or quad mode.
00635  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected QSPI from the QSPI peripherals.
00636  * @param SIO_DIR_INorOUT:
00637  *   This parameter can be one of below:
00638  *     @arg SIO_DIR_IN  : The SIO pins are input mode
00639  *     @arg SIO_DIR_OUT : The SIO pins are output mode
00640  * @retval None
00641  ************************************************************************************************************/
00642 void QSPI_DirectionConfig(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, SIO_DIR_Enum SIO_DIR_INorOUT)
00643 {
00644   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00645   Assert_Param(IS_QSPI(SPIx));
00646   Assert_Param(IS_SIO_DIR(SIO_DIR_INorOUT));
00647 
00648   if (SIO_DIR_INorOUT != SIO_DIR_IN)
00649     SPIx->CR0 |= CR0_QDIODIR_OUT;
00650   else
00651     SPIx->CR0 &= CR0_QDIODIR_IN;
00652 }
00653 #endif
00654 
00655 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00656  * @brief Enable or Disable the SPIx guard time selection function.
00657  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00658  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00659  * @retval None
00660  ************************************************************************************************************/
00661 void SPI_GUARDTCmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, ControlStatus NewState)
00662 {
00663   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00664   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00665   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00666 
00667   (NewState == ENABLE) ? (SPIx->CR0 |= CR0_GUADTEN_SET) : (SPIx->CR0 &= CR0_GUADTEN_RESET);
00668 }
00669 
00670 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00671  * @brief Set the SPIx guard time length.
00672  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00673  * @param Guard_Time: number of SCK to be the guard time length.
00674  *   This parameter can be: SPI_GUADTIME_1_SCK to SPI_GUADTIME_16_SCK.
00675  * @retval None
00676  ************************************************************************************************************/
00677 void SPI_GUARDTConfig(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 Guard_Time)
00678 {
00679   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00680   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00681   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_GUADTIME(Guard_Time));
00682 
00683   SPIx->CR0 = (SPIx->CR0 & 0xF0FF) | (Guard_Time << 8);
00684 }
00685 
00686 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00687  * @brief Set the SPIx chip select hold time.
00688  * @param SPIx: where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
00689  * @param CS_Hold_Time: number of SCK to be the hold time length.
00690  *   This parameter can be: 0 ~ 15
00691  * @retval None
00692  ************************************************************************************************************/
00693 void SPI_SELHTConfig(HT_SPI_TypeDef* SPIx, u32 CS_Hold_Time)
00694 {
00695   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00696   Assert_Param(IS_SPI(SPIx));
00697   Assert_Param(IS_SPI_SELHOLDTIME(CS_Hold_Time));
00698 
00699   SPIx->CR0 = (SPIx->CR0 & 0x0FFF) | (CS_Hold_Time << 12);
00700 }
00701 /**
00702   * @}
00703   */
00704 
00705 
00706 /**
00707   * @}
00708   */
00709 
00710 /**
00711   * @}
00712   */
